intro: Erigeron nubigenus, commonly known as the cloudstem fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has hairy, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in summer, producing a showy display of white to pale yellow petals.
